column4: Hi guys! Yesterday my edubuntu server freezed, and now I see that the syslog shows: "Jun  7 09:12:17 server-basica gnome-power-manager: Hibernating computer because the DBUS method Hibernate() was invoked". What does it mean? thank you!
remove gnome-power-manager from that installation ...
when I try to run gnome-power-manager a window is shown saying: "This program cannot start until you start the dbus session service."  That's strange, because ps shows me that dbus is running...
likely only the system dbus ...
in any case you should remove gnome-power-manager (if thats an edubuntu ltsp server)
ps axu|grep dbus|grep paolo    paolo     4991  0.0  0.0   2712   636 ?        S    07:57   0:00 /usr/bin/dbus-launch --exit-with-session x-session-manager
ok, I'm going to remove it
else users will be able to force hibernation of the server
do you get this dbus error from a thin client or on the server
you mean that yesterday the server hibernated because some client asked it?
from the server
and please dont kill the dbus as __mikem advised, that will break
are you logged in at the same time with the same user from a client ?
no, I'm only on the server.
removing gnome-power-manager removes gnome-session too!!!!
hmm, thats weird, on the server dbus shouldnt complain ...
hmm then just remove it from the default session with the gnome-session-remove command
I gnome-session-remove gnome-power-manager, but I wonder: did I remove from the whole server or only from my user?
only from your users session
and will that solve the problem with the users on the clients hybernating the server?
to remove it for all users just remove (backup) /etc/xdg/autostart/gnome-power-manager.desktop
renaming it in the same directory?
asl long as it doesnt end in .desktop it should be fine
ok
